author: sky.cactus
content: <@104006934562107392> we should rectify ☝️ in the spec.  Is there a way in OpenRPC to indicate `{} | {gas price} | {maxFeePerGas, maxPremiumFeePerGas}`?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@464858726344425472> you can leave off everything.  If you provide one of the 1559 gas properties, you must provide both.  I think that is what the spec is trying to indicate.

author: sky.cactus
content: Actually, I suppose that isbasically what it says now...

author: sky.cactus
content: This is the same as `{gasPrice?} | {maxFeePerGas, maxPremiumFeePerGas}`

author: sky.cactus
content: So maybe no spec change needed.

author: alita85
content: Oh okay sure, I mean I think it'd just be changing gas price to optional.. Which I guess maybe is already there

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, I was incorrect.  It appears everything is fine, just a tad confusing.

author: sky.cactus
content: Does OpenRPC allow for an "empty object"?  If so that may help clear things up.

author: sky.cactus
content: If not, the current spec is correct I think.

author: mrabino1
content: quick question.. w/ 1559 for mainnet, is the gas limit going to be 30MM or 25MM?

author: mrabino1
content: or is it just goig to be double whatever the "day-before" gas limit will be?

author: timbeiko
content: this -> so 30m with the current 15m limit

author: timbeiko
content: if the limit changes before the fork, it will be 2x what it was in the block right before
